div1.p: Copy of Mr. Billinton's Letter Lt. Liebrechts

You have well wanted INTENDED/DELIBERATED, in your letter from the 23 of this month, ce mois, m'entreteur of one complaint in which your Government had been grasped by the missionaries of the "American Baptist Missionary Union" concernany the possession in the from the Congo of their boat "Harry Reed".

I hope that by some explanation, to be in meoura of showing, Mr. Minister, that the facts on which you call to my attention, souraient KNOWING even less established a grief- fondé center my Governemtn
that they are products in the circumstances all exceptional and that of prejudice in which they could given rise to, was alreay atoned fro to the satisfaction of the plaintiffs.

Il be sera oas unnecessary to recall everything first that Mr. Stanley begins his last voyage in Africa nib cinne representative of the State of the Congo, but as an organized expedition by an English committee for the purpose of carrying help a Ennin Paeba dout la position dans le Soudan avait éveillé les sympathies du monde civilisé.
Due to the philanthropic character and unique of his mission, the explorer was within his rights to expect

on the active support of our authorities you will also not be surprised, Mr. Minister, that during your arrival at Stanley-Pool, the expedition finds itself dealing with some difficulties, the commissioner District M. Liebrechts, obliged to lend him all of his services. And these difficulties were serious: us food shortage reigning in the district, the supplies barely sufficient there for the ordinary needs of the population, and the only average of espargner a disaster: to the a la carvane was the était de la metter a même de continuer au plus tôt his voyage. Had presence of this problem. Mr. Stanley had to all of the tous les moyons de transport alors disposables

in the Pool the Baptist missionary granted only the use of his boat although refusal was of the nature to jeapardize the fate of the business may be this consideration allows her to judge the arbitrary process with less rigor of which your compatriot had instantly appealed to in order to achieve his goals. My Government doesn't ne sourait however approve of them, neither sharing the responsibility; his agent, far from having them favored or tolerated, fled there as soon as they had been carrying had his knowledge. On this point, we have satisfy the complaints themselves.
A contract finished by being sined, by the intervention of the granted authority
